title: Ticket #2331: Subdags and DAGMAN_PROHIBIT_MULTI_JOBS do not coexist
description: Configuration in LIGO has DAGMAN_PROHBIT_MULTI_JOBS = True, but this causes subdags to fail. Is this behavior intentional? The LIGO user below says the behavior changed between 7.4 and 7.6, but the code would seem to dispute that assertion, as git archaeology says that the code has not changed since 2006.
remarks:
2011-Jul-25 08:57:05 by nwp: 
Date: Fri, 22 Jul 2011 18:35:22 -0400
From: Duncan Brown <dabrown@physics.syr.edu>
To: Thomas Dent <Thomas.Dent@astro.cf.ac.uk>
Cc: "ML:" <condorligo@aei.mpg.de>
Subject: [CondorLIGO] LIGO: Major bug in dagman in condor 7.6 series

Hi Tom,

I think you have discovered a dagman bug. Lazy planning of subdags no longer works. I created a one-line dag with a sub-dag to test this:

[dbrown@sugar ~]$ cat tom/tom.dag
SUBDAG EXTERNAL 1 /home/dbrown/tom/dent/dent.dag DIR /home/dbrown/tom/dent
RETRY 1 3

The sub-dag is a proper dag containing one job:

[dbrown@sugar ~]$ cat /home/dbrown/tom/dent/dent.dag
JOB 1 denty.sub

[dbrown@sugar ~]$ cat /home/dbrown/tom/dent/denty.sub
universe = vanilla
executable = /bin/hostname
log = /tmp/denty.log
out = denty.out
err = denty.err
queue 1

So this all should work. However, when I submit it, the top-level dag fails with:

07/22/11 18:27:03 Parsing tom.dag ...
07/22/11 18:27:03 MultiLogFiles::readFileToString: safe_fopen_wrapper(/home/dbrown/tom/dent/dent.dag.condor.sub) failed with errno 2 (No such file or directory)
07/22/11 18:27:03 MultiLogFiles: Unable to read file: /home/dbrown/tom/dent/dent.dag.condor.sub
07/22/11 18:27:03 ERROR in MultiLogFiles::getQueueCountFromSubmitFile(): Unable to read file: /home/dbrown/tom/dent/dent.dag.condor.sub
07/22/11 18:27:03 Aborting DAG...
07/22/11 18:27:03 Writing Rescue DAG to tom.dag.rescue001...

Now I can't resubmit this dag, as the rescue dag for the *top level dag* is written in the subdir!

[dbrown@sugar tom]$ ls -l
total 18
drwxr-xr-x 2 dbrown sufaculty    5 Jul 22 18:27 dent
-rw-r--r-- 1 dbrown sufaculty   85 Jul 22 18:26 tom.dag
-rw-r--r-- 1 dbrown sufaculty  972 Jul 22 18:27 tom.dag.condor.sub
-rw-r--r-- 1 dbrown sufaculty  615 Jul 22 18:27 tom.dag.dagman.log
-rw-r--r-- 1 dbrown sufaculty 4550 Jul 22 18:27 tom.dag.dagman.out
-rw-r--r-- 1 dbrown sufaculty    0 Jul 22 18:27 tom.dag.lib.err
-rw-r--r-- 1 dbrown sufaculty   29 Jul 22 18:27 tom.dag.lib.out
[dbrown@sugar tom]$ ls -l dent/
total 5
-rw-r--r-- 1 dbrown sufaculty  16 Jul 22 18:22 dent.dag
-rw-r--r-- 1 dbrown sufaculty 107 Jul 22 18:22 denty.sub
-rw-r--r-- 1 dbrown sufaculty 193 Jul 22 18:27 tom.dag.rescue001

[dbrown@sugar tom]$ condor_submit tom.dag
Submitting job(s)
ERROR: Failed to parse command file (line 1).
[dbrown@sugar tom]$ condor_submit_dag tom.dag

ERROR: "tom.dag.condor.sub" already exists.
ERROR: "tom.dag.lib.out" already exists.
ERROR: "tom.dag.lib.err" already exists.
ERROR: "tom.dag.dagman.log" already exists.

Some file(s) needed by condor_dagman already exist.  Either rename them,
use the "-f" option to force them to be overwritten, or use
the "-update_submit" option to update the submit file and continue.

This all matches exactly what you've seen with your dags. This problem exists with 7.6.1 and 7.6.2

07/22/11 18:27:02 ** $CondorVersion: 7.6.2 Jul 14 2011 BuildID: 351672 $

So we're stuck until Kent fixes it and Stuart upgrades condor.

Cheers,
Duncan.

2011-Jul-25 08:59:04 by nwp: 
Date: Sun, 24 Jul 2011 19:55:00 -0700
From: Duncan Brown <dabrown@physics.syr.edu>
To: Nathan Panike <nwp@cs.wisc.edu>
Cc: Thomas Dent <Thomas.Dent@astro.cf.ac.uk>, "ML:" <condorligo@aei.mpg.de>
Subject: Re: [CondorLIGO] LIGO: Major bug in dagman in condor 7.6 series

Hi Nathan,

On Jul 24, 2011, at 7:43 PM, Nathan Panike wrote:

> I looked at this this evening.

Thanks for taking a look at this.

> This is 7.6.x---for the example below, would you please look at
> dent.dag.dagman.out and at tom.dag.dagman.out and look for the value of
> DAGMAN_PROHIBIT_MULTI_JOBS in each file.

For both of these, it is true:

07/22/11 18:27:03 DAGMAN_PROHIBIT_MULTI_JOBS setting: True


>  For subdags to work, this value must
> be false, and all 7.6 versions of condor_dagman will print the value of this
> configuration variable.

Is that a desired behavior change from 7.4 -> 7.6? We have had this variable set to True in the past to prevent dagman from submitting jobs that have queue values greater than 1 in their submit files. I believe
+this is the desired behavior of the variable. I don't think this variable should control sub-dag submission behavior.

>  If it is true, then condor_dagman is getting it from a
> config file somewhere.

It's coming from the condor_config.local I inherited from Stuart at Caltech:

# Prohibit condor_dagman from running a DAG that references node job submit
# files that queue multiple jobs (other than parallel universe).
DAGMAN_PROHIBIT_MULTI_JOBS = True

>  The solution is to have a CONFIG directive in your
> toplevel dag(s) that points to a config file that explicitly specifies
>
> "DAGMAN_PROHIBIT_MULTI_JOBS = False"
>
> The only way I have successfully reproduced the behavior below here on 7.6 is
> by setting the config directive above to True.

I can try it with the value set to false, but still claim that this needs to be fixed in dagman. We can't go back and edit all our DAGs (which are in various states of progress) to change this, and having
+DAGMAN_PROHIBIT_MULTI_JOBS prevent lazy planning of sub-dags must be a bug, or no? It's certainly not the documented behavior.

Cheers,
Duncan.

2011-Aug-09 10:56:00 by wenger:
Ah, it's entirely accidental that DAGMAN_PROHIBIT_MULTI_JOBS doesn't work with sub-DAGs. I looked at the code, and I think when we added the DAGMAN_PROHIBIT_MULTI_JOBS check we just forgot about sub-DAGs. I suspect that this check will also fail with lazily-created submit files for "regular" jobs. So the real solution is to move the check out of the Job() constructor and put it in just before the job is actually submitted. (Of course, that means that if you don't lazily create your submit files, you won't get the error when you first submit the DAG...).

2011-Aug-09 13:38:34 by wenger:
Hmm -- it just occurred to me that we should turn on DAGMAN_PROHIBIT_MULTIPLE_JOBS in some of the DAGMan tests. Very few of them actually use multi-job nodes, so we should be able to turn this on without affecting the tests, once the bug if fixed...
